As an AI language model, I don't have personal beliefs or opinions, but I can provide you with some potential risks associated with skipping routine dental checkups:

1. Gum disease: Gum disease is a common condition that can lead to tooth loss if left untreated. Without regular cleanings, tartar buildup can lead to gum disease, which can then spread to surrounding teeth.

2. Tooth decay: Regular dental cleanings can help remove plaque buildup that can lead to cavities. Skipping these appointments can increase your risk of developing tooth decay.

3. Oral cancer: During routine dental checkups, dentists often look for signs of oral cancer. Skipping these appointments can lead to a missed diagnosis or delayed treatment.

4. Expensive treatments: Without regular checkups, dental issues can go unnoticed and worsen over time. This can lead to more invasive and expensive treatments such as root canals, crowns, or even tooth extractions.

5. Systemic health problems: Poor oral health has been linked to systemic health problems such as heart disease and diabetes. Regular dental checkups can help detect early signs of these health issues.
